item.content:encoded:
[ Camera, Sound Postproduction ]

Per Cosi Poco was shot in under 1 week, from concept to finished project, at the Cinemadamare Festival in Italy.
I was the main camera and audio postproduction. A lot of ADR, getting rid of small noises and trying to fix everything without having a professional audio booth to record anything. Making the sound postproduction quite interesting.
It won:
Best Sound
Best Film
Best Actor
Best script

[ Camera, Editing, Audio Postproduction ]

This is the teaser for a 50 min documentary.
The August Project is a 50 minute documentary that follows 5 artists who meet for the very first time in Ghent. They sleep and work in the same room, learning how to live together and what live is actually about. It was shot over 7 days and edited in 2-3 months.

item.content:encoded:
[ Directing, 2nd Camera, Editing, Audio postproduction, Effects and animation ]

Teleurdeugd speaks about the omnipresent theme of depression and psychological issues without trying to moralize the audience. The film doesn’t offer answers or solutions, instead it invites to reflect on and speak about these problems. It had a theatrical release with 800 sold tickets. A collaborative project with 5 people that took 2 years.
